subject: RE: [junit] HTTP Unit vs HTML Unit
msgSnippet: I am not an expert tester, but I have used HttpUnit. I liked it and it got the job done for me. I had to write a few helper classes to overcome some weaknesses
messageBody:
I am not an expert tester, but I have used HttpUnit. I liked it and it got the job done for me. I had to write a few helper classes to overcome some weaknesses that I found in it, but other than that, I found it very usable. I have never used HtmlUnit, so I can't comment.

Try them and see. Create a small test page with things that you want to test on it, and try testing it with both libraries. That's the best answer you could possibly have. Anything else is the opinion of someone you have never met and have no basis to judge their technical competence.

Simon

>-----Original Message-----
>From: Mike Duffy [mailto:mduffy_lists@...]
>Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 2004 4:25 PM
>To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [junit] HTTP Unit vs HTML Unit
>
>
>I assume that the people on this list are expert testers.
>
>Could you please give me some guidance on HTTP Unit vs HTML Unit.
>
>Thx in advance.
>
>Mike
